isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Engine Systems - Electronic Control System - Glow Plug Control System

svcproc.title: Glow Plug Control System
svcproc.para: The glow plug control system warms the engine cylinders to aid cold engine starting and reduce exhaust emissions during warm-up.
The ECM energizes the glow plug relay while monitoring programmed conditions for engine coolant temperature and atmospheric pressure.
The ECM controls the wait to start lamp and glow plugs based on ECT and EOT. The wait to start lamp (0 to 10 seconds) ON-time is independent from the glow plugs (0 to 120 seconds) ON-time.
The ECM controls the wait to start lamp through public CAN communication to the electronic gauge cluster.

The power is supplied to the switch side of the relay from the starter motor through a fusible link. When the relay is energized, power is supplied to the glow plugs, which are grounded through the cylinder heads.
